body:
@emmanuel:

I think José is suggesting that a patch be made about this to split out the dependencies from the `rails` gemspec so that they aren't just "dead weight" in the bundle. This would require a large thought process change, as applications would be generated, by default, with a list of [all the gems](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/rails.gemspec#L20-26) that Rails depends on.

Of course, this would mean that you would need to run `bundle install` on a "full" application to get all those little gems like `activerecord` or `activesupport` that you would normally get "for free" by installing the `rails` gem. Alternatively, you could still install these manually using `gem install activerecord`.

I agree with you though, this would lessen the number of gems that Bundler had to look up and really decrease that "dead weight" mentioned a few times already. Patches very, very welcome.

Finally:

> I sincerely hope I didn't earn a spot in your kill-file for bulldogging you on such a simple little thing). So I'll drop it.

People earn a spot in my "kill-file" for being outright assholes, immature or just plain annoying. Your concern is valid and appreciated, and so you're not even close to being in there. Chill bro ;)
